headline: Bloom Energy Utility Deal Raises Questions On Valuation And Future Returns
summary: Bloom Energy (NYSE:BE) has signed a multi billion dollar, multi year supply agreement with major U.S. utility American Electric Power. The deal centers on deploying Bloom's energy server technology across AEP's service areas over an extended period. The contract value is reported to be well above Bloom Energy's previous annual revenues, making it a materially large commercial win. For investors watching NYSE:BE, this agreement lands at a time when the stock is trading at $156.13 and has...

headline: Why Bloom Energy Rallied Almost 75% in January
summary: Bloom Energy announced a mega-deal with a big U.S. utility company early in the month.

headline: American Electric Banks on Investments and Renewables for Growth
summary: AEP ramps up grid and renewable spending, backed by a massive transmission network, even as reliance on a few retail providers adds risks.

headline: American Electric Power Company, Inc. (AEP): A Bear Case Theory
summary: We came across a bearish thesis on American Electric Power Company, Inc. on Value investing subreddit by 404_usrntfnd. In this article, we will summarize the bears’ thesis on AEP. American Electric Power Company, Inc.’s share was trading at $119.21 as of January 29th. AEP’s trailing and forward P/E were 17.44 and 18.94 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. […]
